text:
Haytap - Animal Rights Federation in Turkey
August 28 at 4:23 PM Â·

Wonderful News for Whales and DOLPHÄ°NS!

The news that #ShinzoAbe is retiring is wonderful news for the whales, especially whales in the vicinity of the dangerous waters around Japan.

#Abe has been the strongest and most vocal supporter of Japanese whaling. He comes from a whaling district and under his rule #Japan has worked to try and legalize whaling by the International Whaling Commission. In that regard he failed and was forced to end the illegal slaughter of whales in the Southern Ocean Whale Sanctuary.

Abe has also been a strong supporter of the slaughter of dolphins at Taiji, Japan, one of the cruelest and bloodiest annual dolphin massacres on the planet.

The world will be a safer place for #whales and #dolphins once this despicably cruel man is no longer in power.

#HAYTAP

Haytap - Animal Rights Federation in Turkey
January 31 at 10:42 AM Â·

We can't say we weren't warned:

Having spent the past decade traveling the world, documenting the wildlife trade, I've seen every animal imaginable sold as pets, for their meat, or for voodoo and religious sacrifices.

The recent outbreak in China is a result of a long history of consuming 'exotic' animals. On the markets in Wuhan were dogs, koalas, monkeys, snakes, and bats, which are known to harbor around 137 diseases alone.

In short, if it moves, it can end up on a menu in China, along with many other countries around the world. This isn't just a Chinese problem though, it's a global crisis.

Animals in these markets have normally been ripped from their families in the wild. They are thenâ€¦

24.06.2004 Tarih ve 5199 Sayili Hayvanlari Koruma Kanunun 4/a fikrasinca butun hayvanlar esit dogar ve bu kanun hukumleri cercevesinde yasama hakkina sahiptir. Bu Kanunun amaci; Hayvanlarin rahat yasamalarini ve hayvanlara iyi ve uygun muamele edilmesini, temin etmek, hayvanlarin aci, istirap ve eziyet cekmelerine karsi en iyi sekilde korunmalarini, her turlu magduriyetlerinin onlenmesini saglamaktir.

5199 sayili kanunun 17 maddesi hukumlerine uyulup uyulmadigini denetleme yetkisi Bakanliga aittir.Bakanlikca bu yetki mahalin en buyuk mulki amirine yetki devri suretiyle devredilir.
